filmography.title: From Here to Eternity
filmography.role_description: A sadistic stockade sergeant who brutally beats Frank Sinatra's character, establishing Borgnine as a terrifying screen villain.
filmography.plot: In Hawaii in 1941, a private is cruelly punished for not boxing in his unit's team, while his captain's wife and second-in-command are falling in love.

filmography.title: Johnny Guitar
filmography.role_description: A knife-wielding outlaw and member of the Dancin' Kid's gang in this stylized, psychological western.
filmography.plot: A strong-willed saloon owner battles the local townspeople and a rival rancher who want to force her out.

filmography.title: Demetrius and the Gladiators
filmography.role_description: A burly gladiator who fights Demetrius in the arena in this biblical sequel to 'The Robe'.
filmography.plot: A Christian slave is sentenced to the arena, where his faith is tested by the brutality of the games and the seduction of Messalina.

filmography.title: Vera Cruz
filmography.role_description: A greedy mercenary and member of Burt Lancaster's gang, looking for gold during the Mexican Revolution.
filmography.plot: During the Mexican Rebellion of 1866, an unsavory group of American adventurers are hired to escort a countess to Vera Cruz.

filmography.title: Bad Day at Black Rock
filmography.role_description: A menacing henchman who tries to intimidate Spencer Tracy's character, leading to a famous judo fight scene.
filmography.plot: A one-armed stranger comes to a tiny town and uncovers a terrible secret that the citizens will kill to keep.

filmography.title: Marty
filmography.role_description: A lonely, middle-aged Bronx butcher who finds an unexpected chance at love; the role that won him the Oscar.
filmography.plot: A middle-aged butcher and a school teacher who have given up on the idea of love meet at a dance and fall for each other.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Actor; Golden Globe: Win – Best Actor (Drama); BAFTA: Win – Best Foreign Actor

filmography.title: The Catered Affair
filmography.role_description: A struggling taxi driver who clashes with his wife (Bette Davis) over spending their life savings on their daughter's wedding.
filmography.plot: A working-class mother fights to give her daughter an expensive wedding, causing tension with her husband.

filmography.title: The Best Things in Life Are Free
filmography.role_description: The real-life lyricist and part of the famous DeSylva, Brown, and Henderson songwriting team.
filmography.plot: A musical biography of the songwriting trio responsible for hits like 'Button Up Your Overcoat' and 'Birth of the Blues'.

filmography.title: The Vikings
filmography.role_description: The boisterous, fierce Viking king and father to Kirk Douglas's character (despite being only a month younger in real life).
filmography.plot: Einar and Eric are two half-brothers and rivals for the throne of Northumbria and the love of Princess Morgana.

filmography.title: The Badlanders
filmography.role_description: An ex-convict who teams up with Alan Ladd to rob a gold mine in this Western remake of 'The Asphalt Jungle'.
filmography.plot: Two men are released from an Arizona prison in 1898 and decide to rob a corrupt mine owner.

filmography.title: Pay or Die
filmography.role_description: The real-life NYPD detective who formed the 'Italian Squad' to fight the Black Hand extortion racket in the early 1900s.
filmography.plot: A New York City police lieutenant fights the Black Hand in Little Italy during the early 20th century.

filmography.title: Barabbas
filmography.role_description: A gladiator who befriends the biblical figure Barabbas and converts to Christianity in the arena.
filmography.plot: Pontius Pilate offers the crowd a choice of releasing Jesus or Barabbas. Barabbas is released and ultimately faces his own spiritual journey.

filmography.title: McHale's Navy
filmography.role_description: The easy-going commander of a PT boat who leads his misfit crew in schemes during WWII; film version of his hit TV show.
filmography.plot: The crew of PT-73 organizes a horse race betting scheme to help an orphanage, getting into trouble with the brass.

filmography.title: The Flight of the Phoenix
filmography.role_description: A mentally unstable oil worker who succumbs to the heat and madness after a plane crash in the Sahara.
filmography.plot: After a cargo plane crashes in the Sahara desert, the survivors attempt to build a new plane from the wreckage to fly out.

filmography.title: The Dirty Dozen
filmography.role_description: The commanding officer who assigns Lee Marvin's character the suicide mission to train convicts for war.
filmography.plot: A rebellious U.S. Army Major is assigned a dozen convicted murderers to train and lead them into a mass assassination mission of German officers.

filmography.title: Ice Station Zebra
filmography.role_description: A Russian defector and spy working with the Americans on a nuclear submarine mission to the Arctic.
filmography.plot: A US submarine commander races the Soviets to the North Pole to retrieve a downed spy satellite.

filmography.title: The Wild Bunch
filmography.role_description: A loyal, hardened member of Pike Bishop's outlaw gang who participates in the bloody final standoff.
filmography.plot: An aging group of outlaws look for one last big score as the 'traditional' American West disappears around them.

filmography.title: Willard
filmography.role_description: The cruel boss who torments his employee Willard, eventually meeting a gruesome fate at the hands of Willard's rats.
filmography.plot: A social misfit who is bullied by his boss and mother befriends a colony of rats and uses them to exact revenge.

filmography.title: The Poseidon Adventure
filmography.role_description: A tough-talking police detective on his honeymoon who constantly clashes with the priest leading the survivors.
filmography.plot: A group of passengers struggle to survive and escape when their ocean liner completely capsizes at sea.

filmography.title: Emperor of the North
filmography.role_description: A sadistic railway conductor who will kill any hobo who tries to ride his train for free.
filmography.plot: A hobo king challenges the conductor who has sworn that no one will ever ride his train for free.

filmography.title: Hustle
filmography.role_description: A corrupt police supervisor in this gritty neo-noir starring Burt Reynolds.
filmography.plot: A police detective and a call girl get involved in a complex case involving the death of a young woman.

filmography.title: The Devil's Rain
filmography.role_description: A warlock and cult leader who leads a satanic group in the desert, melting his enemies.
filmography.plot: A Satanist leader seeks a book of names that will allow him to deliver souls to the devil.

filmography.title: Convoy
filmography.role_description: A corrupt, vindictive sheriff who relentlessly pursues a convoy of truckers across state lines.
filmography.plot: Truckers form a mile-long convoy in support of a trucker's vendetta with an abusive sheriff.

filmography.title: The Black Hole
filmography.role_description: A cowardly journalist aboard a spaceship who tries to escape a mad scientist's vessel, leading to his doom.
filmography.plot: A research vessel finds a missing ship, commanded by a mysterious scientist, on the edge of a black hole.

filmography.title: Escape from New York
filmography.role_description: A jazz-loving taxi driver who has survived in the prison city of Manhattan and aids Snake Plissken.
filmography.plot: In 1997, when the U.S. president crashes into Manhattan, now a giant maximum security prison, a convicted bank robber is sent in to rescue him.

filmography.title: Gattaca
filmography.role_description: The head janitor who knows the protagonist's secret but keeps it; a warm, paternal late-career role.
filmography.plot: A genetically inferior man assumes the identity of a superior one in order to pursue his lifelong dream of space travel.

filmography.title: RED
filmography.role_description: The records keeper at the CIA headquarters who helps his old friends; Borgnine's final major film appearance.
filmography.plot: When his peaceful life is threatened by a high-tech assassin, former black-ops agent Frank Moses reassembles his old team in a last-ditch effort to survive.
